alert.note: Alert for Grant (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 20 at 6:44PM PDT until May 20 at 7:30PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN GRANT COUNTY... At 644 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Seneca, Izee and Silvies. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
